data.text:
Sonu Sood

Sonu Sood is one of India's most well-known celebrities. He has a large fan base after assisting thousands of migrant workers in the country and facilitating them to reach their destination. Sonu Sood is a kind-hearted man. So, here, we'll tell you everything you need to know about Sonu Sood's net Worth, lifestyle, and biography.

Early Life

Sonu Sood was born on July 30, 1973, in Moga, Punjab, India. His father, Shakti Sagar Sood, had a textile company, and his mother's name was Saroj Sood. Sonu is from an upper-middle-class family. After completing high school, he worked at his father's business. Then, he pursued B.tech in Electronic Engineering at Nagpur's Yeshwantrao Chavan College of Engineering. After that, he moved to Mumbai searching for a job, and he now shares an apartment with six other men.

He began acting from the Movie titled "Kallazhagar" in 1999 and the Bollywood movie "Shaheed-E-Azam" in 2000. Some of his outstanding Telugu films are Arundhati and Athadu.

Sonu Sood's Physical Stats & More

Age 48 Years (As in 2021) Height 6.2 Feet Weight 65 kg Eye Color Black Skin Color Fair Hair Color Black Tatto Yes

Marital Status, Affairs, Girlfriends

Sonu Sood Favorite & Beloved Things

Color Blue Food Pizza, Ice Cream, and Grilled Sandwich Actor Anil Kapoor Actress Sara Ali Khan Singer Himanshi Khurana Holiday Destination Place New York Hobbies Dancing, Travelling & Shopping

Sonu Sood Acting Career

In the Tamil film 'Kallazhagar,' Sonu Sood made his acting debut in 1999. He also starred in the film "Nenjinile" in the same year. He made his Telugu debut in the year 2000 with the film 'Hands Up!' Sandhitha Velai and Majunu were among his Tamil movies by 2001.

In 2002, he made his Bollywood debut in the film "Shaheed-E-Azam." Before becoming well-known in 2005 for his role in the Bollywood film 'Aashiq Banaya Apne,' he acted in various Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu films.

He debuted in the Kannada cinema business in 2011 with the film 'Vishnuvardhana.' He made his Mandarin cinema debut in 2016 with the movie 'Xuanzang.' With the Pakistani film 'Ishq Positive,' he made his Urdu cinematic debut in the same year.

Super, Ashok, Arundhati, Jodha Akbar, Anjaneyulu, Ek Niranjan, Dabangg, and a number of more films in Telugu, Tamil, and Hindi are among his numerous achievements.

Sonu Sood Lifestyle

As you may be aware, Sonu Sood is among the most famous persons in India today, thanks to his humanity, assisting people in returning to Indian cinema, and playing various excellent roles in real life. Sonu Sood works in both Hindi and Southern Indian films and his fan base is enormous.

Sonu Sood has also won various film industry accolades, including Best Supporting Actor in Arundhati, Best Actor in a Negative Role, and IIFA Award for Best Actor in a Negative Role for the super-hit film Dabangg starring Salman Khan.

Sonu Sood Net Worth

Sonu Sood's approximate Net Worth in 2020, his salary, income, cars, lifestyle, wife, height, and biography, all facts are presented below.

Net Worth in 2019 - $1 Million - $5 Million (Approx.)

Estimated Net Worth in 2018 - $100,000 - $1 Million

Annual Income - Salary Under Review

Profession - Movie Actor, Producer, Model

Sonu Sood House - Sonu Sood and his family reside in beautiful homes and bungalows under their name and the Sood family has assets worth up to 1000 crores. Sonu Sood holds 2,600 square-feet four-bedroom flats in Andheri, as well as farmhouses and bungalows in Mumbai.

Sonu Sood Car's - Sonu Sood reportedly owns several high-end cars, planes, and other properties. He has Mercedes Benz ML-Class, Porsche Panamera, and Audi Q7, all high-end vehicles.

Five Heart-warming Initiatives by Sonu Sood

1. Accommodating Health Workers

Many health care workers, including physicians, had to cope with the risk of getting COVID-19, long shifts of duty, and deal with professional distress and social shame when the government declared the statewide lockdown in March 2019. Sonu Sood, who owns a hotel in Mumbai's Juhu neighborhood, offered them assistance and a place to stay.

2. Feeding the Hungry

Most industries and companies were forced to close due to the corona virus epidemic, resulting in severe jobs losses and food insecurity. Those who were employed in the informal sector were disproportionately affected by the crisis. Several contract and migrant workers could not afford even three meals each day due to a lack of stable employment. At that time, Sonu Sood became Maseeha for them and provided food to many.

3. Transporting Migrants Back to Their Home

Thousands of migrants were obliged to return to their homes due to the lockdown. Because of the shortage of infrastructure, many individuals choose to walk long distances. Some even attempted a 1,000-kilometer hike in search of a haven. Thus, Sonu Sood understood their pain and arranged a free transport facility for them so that they can reach their destination safely.
